title: Fish Size Project
text:
Fish Size Project






Our Vision



The Fish Size Project aims to understand human impacts on fish size diversity in order to reveal what we have lost, what this means for humans, for fish and aquatic ecosystems and what can we do to bring back the oceans, lakes and rivers full of large fish.





Our Aim
We work on the methods to assess human impacts using limited and diverse data sources, for all fish species around the world. We use different experiments and models to reveal how fish size changes might affect fisheries and marine ecosystems.








Meet the team



Fish Size Project is based at the University of Tasmania, but we collaborate with CSIRO, Danish Technical University and many other organisations around the world.
Ideally have the figure with photos in here





Our impact
